I love that feature.Overall, the Galaxy Note is a very useful device with the most features of all three and is the most flexible. However, I use it the least. My main tablet usage is surfing the internet, reading magazines/newspapers, watching movies/TV, editing photos and the iPad is still my go-to device due to it's shape, speed, and app eco-system. Kindle HDX is next for it's video-viewing and all the content I have from Amazon. Samsung Galaxy Note though versatile is not my go-to device for any one thing - so it loses out. However, it comes the closest to a PC replacement if I did more office work on my tablet so I still like having it around especially when I travel.The Galaxy Note came with a ton of freebies like Google Play and Samsung Store credit, expanded Dropbox for 2 years, Boingo membership for one year, Businessweek subscription for a year, Hulu Plus membership for 3 months which was very nice. No other device offered all these freebies so if they're still being offered when you buy the tablet, factor that into the cost.

Reviews.Title: another winner
Reviews.Author: Mary F. Hazlett "mhazlett"
Reviews.Content: I have owned every Samsung Note tablet/phone except the first Note phone.  So you can say i love the Note serries.  I have also owned nearly every Samsung tablet, many  Kindles, Nooks, and have the Ipad 2 and had the ipad mini (first mini).  So, i'm well rounded.  To think i went into technology kicking and screaming in the early 2000's!This tablet is awesome.  I've definitely note explored all of the features yet on it because at the present time i also own the Note 8 and my phone is the Note 3.  I've also for the first time learned how to sync my SNotes with Evernote; that may sound basic, but i didn't know how to do it and now someone at Best Buy spent time with me helping me learn.I own the Note series because I like Android -- for those who say that there are many more choices in the apple app stores i say how many apps does one really need?  Everything i look for is available in the Play store.The multi window function is great, although i don't make use of it as  often as those who work might.  I retired a few years ago. I buy the series because of the S pen.  I keep a journal, and enjoy handwriting it.  I love keeping one on papeer, but when i am traveling without my large backpack/messenger bag, i can handwrite on this.  I also use the SNote function to keep a grocery list on my phone.  I save all kinds of things in Scrapbook, such as tips from a great source called Dripler (in the Google Play store).  I also like the fact that when i do my banking, i can, using the Spen, bring up a calculator on the check page to do my checkbook balancing.This baby comes with a lot of perks.  Off the bat i received a credit for $25 in the Play store, $50 in the Samsung Hub store, free magazines from Zinio (i don't get the crredit because i already have the app -- by the way, many public libraries have Zinio -- magazines -- available for checkout and unlike books, when a magazine is checked out, you keep the magazine), a 3-month Audible trial for audio books in Amazon (again, because i already have an account, i am not eligible), and 50G of free dropbox storage.  And, a free 3month trial of the NYTimes. Samsung says these freebies are worth $600.I'm not wild about the price, but if i held off for a while, the price would come down.  I thought and thought about whether to get this new 10.1 2014 Note since i currently have and use the Note 8, as well as my phone.  I also use my ipad, but because it is in a leather keyboard folio, it is heavy to cart around if i just want to lighten my load.  Yes, i can remove it from the folio.  But an advantage of android is the Swype feature -- being able to slide my fingers from letter to letter on the keyboard.  It is easier than the hunt and peck typing method on the on-screen keyboard of the ipad.  I do have several portable keyboards, but the one i'm currently using when i want a keyboard is an excellent one by Brookstone.  I have the one with the little shelf which can hold a device on it.  But because the keyboard can be removed, i can simply slide this slim full-size keyboard in my bag if i want to.  The whole thing is lighter than my keyboard folio for the ipad.  Many small bluetooth keyboards are weird -- when i type on them foreign symbols pop up and i have to select what i want, slowing down the typing.  I'm a good typist, and the brrokstone is simply a regular but lighthweighth keyboard.I highly recommend this tablet. It is fun, good for professionals, comes with great features and lots of 3-month expensive freebies, and it has -- oh yeah -- an expandable memory, unlike the fruit tablets. That is also a big selling point.  I have all of my music on a micro card and can simply put the card into the Note series.You can't go wrong.  I used my tax refund to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Way better than your iPad
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Wow....I love this tablet.  When my 12 year old apple fan starts thinking Android because of the features I use, I know this is a great device.  Just for fun, next time you are on a plane next to someone with an iPad, open your email and web browser at the same time, then pull out the S-Pen. Hover, click and open a third window with something else.  No argument, this is a bitchin tablet.Couple thaings I would change:The apps available for split screen could be more plentiful.There could be easier access to recent apps.This is really not Samsung's fault, but there are so many features, it would be helpful to have better documentation on how to use them all.I would certainly recommend this tablet. I was blown away day one and two weeks later I am still giggling like a kid every time I discover some new trick or feature.

Reviews.Title: A solid, intelligent, and unique product among tablets
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Individuals have complained about "lag" or "stutter," but I haven't truly experienced this at all. To be honest, this is the best tablet experience I've ever had. I purchased this primarily to aid with note taking and productivity, and to that end it works perfectly. Unlike the other tablets, the S pen makes this tablet a piece of technology that increases the range of things I can do rather than replicating functions of my laptop. The screen is truly amazing, and not a few iPad owners have asked me what kind of tablet I have in the last few weeks.You can't go wrong here if you're looking for a solid productivity tablet. The price is expensive, but you're getting a premium product and you do indeed get some perks ($25 Google playstore credit, $50 in the amazon store, 2 years of premium dropbox storage, etc.)I had originally held off purchasing the Note because I wanted to see what the Nexus 10 had in store, but I changed my mind on account of the complete disconnect in communication with the latest nexus products. I'm very glad I did make this jump, as this tablet performs everything I wanted it to in a manner better than I had expected. If you're hesitating, I recommended taking the plunge.

Reviews.Title: Loving Samsung
Reviews.Author: Todd Bennett
Reviews.Content: Puts any iPad I've ever owned to shame...fast, beautiful and so easy to use. Learning to Android platform takes a little time but well worth the effort!

Reviews.Title: It might not be perfect but it sure is magical.
Reviews.Author: Fedge
Reviews.Content: This is a great overall tablet.  This includes both it's hardware and user experience; it offers many features that can not be found on other popular devices out there.I say if you were considering buying the Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 or recommending it to a friend do not hesitate; it is magical device that does not disappoint. Though if you do not plan to utilize the s pen or multitasking capabilities and like the android os you are better off with a device that sells for a lot less.It is pricey but the 32GB Note 10.1 2014 is the same price as the 32GB iPad and it offers far more features and the ability to add a microsd card making it a far better buy in my mind.For my full review of Samsung's Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 please visit  [...]

Reviews.Title: SCREEN IS FAULTY AFTER 3 WEEKS???
Reviews.Author: ken chew
Reviews.Content: screen started flickering after 3 weeks, without dropping or damaging it. luckily Amazon is good enough to give me a free replacement promptly. Awaiting the replacement now.

Reviews.Title: College student
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet. I really debated getting this or surface pro due to needing to write on and edit powerpoints. I went with this for the price and since my school has integrated to using Google. I wasn't sure about snote but after playing with it I realized it's very easy to use and everything I was looking for. I leaned toward the surface since it has PowerPoint built in but the note imported my slides easily and can edit any way I want. Tons of options. So far it's great. I'd recommend to a student with similar interests. As for everyone else, I used a ton of apps and had no troubles except for Evernote, the first time. After that it was fine. I didnt hear the original 10.1 speakers but they are no longer on the front. I have no problem with them where they are. They sound great to me. The stylus seems a bit small since I have large hands but I'm used to it now. Hope this helps. Sorry for any typos, I typed this with my s4.

Reviews.Title: Extremely satisfied!
Reviews.Author: Crystiannia
Reviews.Content: Initially was nervous about purchasing refurbished, but went ahead and it was a great decision. Item looked brand new and worked perfectly: no scratches, no quirks.

Reviews.Title: What I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: Tuan Tran "tuanskie"
Reviews.Content: I'll give it 5 stars because it is the one tablet that serves my purposes. If 1/2 stars were possible, then I'd give it 4.5 because of the high price tag. I work in academia and run my own research lab. I have to attend various meetings and many other functions that require a lot of thoughts to be thrown around, saved, and eventually have to follow-up on them. I've owned a Galaxy Tab 10.1 (first generation), Google Nexus 10, and Apple iPad 3, trying to be patient with the Note series until it matured and wasn't yet sold on the idea of the S-Pen let alone a generic stylus. Well, it has matured and has the muscle behind it. The S-Pen feature is what separates this tablet apart from the aforementioned tablets, as they all were simply media consumption devices and had no further usefulness beyond checking email and watching videos. I'm not a game player, so I really don't care for this aspect. The built-in Samsung apps are very basic and don't offer a great experience. Thus, I felt compelled to look beyond the Sammie ecosystem. Thus, I downloaded a free Android app called, "Papyrus," paid for a few premium features costing around $3 each, and I have never looked back. Note-taking with this app complements the capabilities of the S-Pen very well. The pen is sensitive and responsive enough to feel like natural hand writing -- granted, it is not absolutely perfect, but for what it's worth, it is great. The Papyrus app does what it's supposed to without being too gimmicky and cute like other writing apps.Pros:1. Quickly, easily, and accurately write down important notes and save or convey/share those thoughts to others.2. Mirror my tablet on an HD television screen in a meeting room and write everything so people can collaborate / review in real time.3. Export or share notes in various formats (PDF, PNG, JPG) via email, SMS, and the usual set of sharing mediums.4. With #3 above, I find it very useful to MMS my notes, as it reduces the need for typing a full-blown message. Anyone with a tablet knows that typing stinks, no matter what brand you have. Steve Jobs was completely wrong about the utility of the stylus!5. S-Pen is very accurate and responsive. You can also lay your palm on the screen while writing and there's no "background" pickup. It can be accessed easily and stored discretely.6. Tablet has the hardware specs capable of handling what I need to do -- use productivity apps, watch videos/movies on the plane, and a whole lot more!7. Did I mention that the screen resolution is awesome? Well, it's awesome!Cons:PriceBuilt-in Samsung S-Pen apps still weak -- find yourself some other Android appsIf you are serious about being productive at work while also being able to enjoy "intense" multimedia, then this device will not let you down. It is not bulky or heavy as the Nexus 10 2013 that I had, looks great, and is a joy to use. Your friends and co-workers will be jealous.

Reviews.Title: Far superior to an iPad
Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: I use this tablet as an artist, for drawing and painting and various Graphic Design projects. As a Graphic Design student I cannot express how useful this tablet is. The pen uses a Wacom digitizer. Instead of hauling my Wacom tablet to class every day, I just take the tablet to create digital works, which I can then port to Photoshop, Illustrator, or whatever. The stylus is far superior to those which work with an iPad, and you save money by having a stylus that is built in to this tablet. If you are an artist or an art student looking for a tablet that will increase your productivity I highly suggest the Note over the iPad. I know that Apple computers are the industry standard in the Art world, but this tablet should be the exception to that "rule". Art kids, abandon your Apple tablets and get yourself a Note.Speaking of Note! The note taking capabilities of this tablet are amazing. For once, I'm an organized note taker. I have abandoned the lined paper notebook and I use this tablet solely for note taking in my Art History classes. I love how I can drag pictures into my notes, which is absolutely a bonus, and an important feature in helping me learn Art History. Instead of having to download a huge PDF with slides from a lecture on art, and flip through my paper notebook to find the corresponding artworks, I just drag the artworks over into my notes and everything is right there. It's awesome!This tablet is very fast, very snappy, and responsive. I have no issues at all with it's speed. Even when running many apps at once, and while using a custom launcher app, it's still fast.I love this thing. I am incredibly happy with my purchase. I literally cannot imagine my life without this thing, now that I've had it for a few months. It is an integral part to my education and my life. I should do commercials for Samsung. :)

Reviews.Title: Top of the Line Tablet, Mediocre Samsung Support
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Sean Holder Photography"
Reviews.Content: So here's my take on this tablet:1. The additional items that Samsung is playing up in their advertisement as being $600 of free stuff, is complete garbage. The $50 credit they give you for the Samsung hub is a joke, the bookstore has nothing worth purchasing except garbage books, the App Store that Samsung has is complete joke also. The only added value is the 25 dollar credit with Google Play. Everything else you're going to get a free trial and then they want you to get a subscription with a monthly fee. So it's a complete marketing scam by Samsung to get you to buy this tablet.2. Okay now is the tablet worth $550 for the 32mb version? I would say yes.3. The other reason I do not rate this a five star is because its not running the latest version of Android. You would think, at least I would think, that if this is your flag ship model that research and development would have worked endless hours to give you the latest updated edition since its release last year. But no it's still running Androd Jelly Bean 4.3 which is not a bad thing but when you're spending this kind of money you would expect a and company like Samsung to be at the top of their game.4. Why did I pick Samsung over the iPad? The biggest reason I got this tablet was because of the stylus s-pen verses touch only types of tablet. If Apple had a tablet with a stylus with Wacom technology similar to this one I more than likely I would have gone with the iPad, reason being is their updates seem to come out faster from their R&D; division. For some reason Android products seem to be hit or miss on whether you're going to get an update or not or if you do get the update it takes forever, this tablet was released October 2013 and it still does not have the KitKat update for Android how ridiculous is that.5. So how does the tablet work? After I purchased the tablet I went to the Samsung store and I purchased the Bluetooth keyboard and the USB adapter. I have to say this almost works as good as a laptop with the keyboard and the USB adapter. I am able to plug in my portable 2tb external hard drive by Western Digital, this is a huge plus being a photographer that this little tablet can actually power my external hard drive for when I want to show images to clients. Again the keyboard is an awesome addition if you wanna sit and type something verses using the S-pen or finger typing.Final note, I'm going to give this tablet a chance and hope the updates come out soon and the biggest test is going to see if later this year probably several several months from now when Android 4.5 is released if this tablet gets updated to that version. The last thing I want to do is be spending this type of money every year and a half to two years when a new update for Android comes out and the company doesn't support the upgrades. I have that issue with Toshiba Thrive 10 inch tablet this was a very promising tablet but once they got to Android Ice Cream Sandwich version they stopped. There were no more updates, no more support which was truly disappointing since I really enjoyed the Toshiba company. But when companies do not take care of their clients, the ones that support them they will lose them. Case in point as for me I will never purchase a Toshiba item again, I am currently very very happy with this Samsung tablet.Does this tablet have value that an Apple iPad air does not have? Yes it certainly does the multi task window is a huge feature that Apple would probably need to learn to implement into their tablet. The s-pen is huge the Wacom technology is spot on I've been using a Wacom tablet to edit my photos on my computer for several several years and to have this feature on a tablet is awesome.So again to recap the added value that Samsung is pushing on their advertisement that you get this supposedly $600 in extra stuff is a complete scam in my eyes. To me the value is only really $25 for the Google Play Store other than that everything else is a waste.Will I keep this tablet? Definitely it's a great tablet let's see how soon Samsung can get there research and development team together and get it updated, and keep it updated with the latest versions of the Android software and not take 6 or more months from release date and have you still waiting for the update and at the same time call this their top of the line model when its not even running the most current Android software.

Reviews.Title: Beats iPad
Reviews.Author: C. Steinbrecher "CWS"
Reviews.Content: I got my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1" 2014 edition one week ago.  Intent was to transition my iPad to my wife who is comfortable with her iPhone and me to adopt the Galaxy Note as I really like my Galaxy S3 phone and am looking for maximum compatibility.  I have been exceptionally pleased.  More and more I belive that the Apple products, while they do have some very nice features, just seem to lock you out of too many things.  For example, try transporting your Apple address book somewhere else, good luck with that.  The google address book gives you so much more flexibility and power.The screen on the Galaxy Note is incredible.  The form factor being a little wider is also generally very nice.  Some Aps although do not scale quite as well to this - for example my application to read the San Diego Union Tribune seems to be sized more for the iPad - not a huge deal though.The internet browser on the Galaxy Note seems superior to me.  It just works better and seems to support more websites and particularly video formats that you can not view on the iPad.Love how you can install your own micro SD memory card in the Samsung products.  You can buy a good quality 64Gb microSD for a fraction of what Apple charges you to get 64Gb of memory.EMail Ap provided with the Galaxy Note is very nice and easy to use.GPS Receiver Built In - very nice built-in GPS receiver.  My iPad2 does not have this.  Don't know if the more recent iPads do or not.  Works very well and of course integrates great with hte GoogleMaps and since this is an Android device no problems there.  You do need wireless access for your maps to update as you move around the country but I did find a free Ap that allows you to download maps for free (Navigator) that appears a good option.Dropbox - Samsung gives you 2 years subscription with 50Gb storage to Dropbox.  I am very impressed with the ease of use of Dropbox on the Samsung Galaxy Note as well as my home laptop.  I can even look up files from my work computer network by just logging into my dropbox account.  This is very convenient.In general, I am thrilled with my Galaxy Note 10.1 2014.  It is generally very intuitive and I find it to be more powerful in many ways than the iPad.  Did I mention the ability to open a second application to the side or in a subwindow - very convenient at times.  There are a few drawbacks compared to the Apple iPad which I will list below.  - Ap Support - the application availablity for the Galaxy Note is excellent but not as good as for Apple.  If you have a popula Ap on your Apple device I would estimate an 80% probability the Ap will be available on the Androis as well.  But there have been some supriises.  I have been running an Ap on my iPad and Galaxy S3 Phone to track my NCAA mens basketball bracket and mysteriously it does not seem to be available for the Galaxy Note.  Similarly, my Glo Bible ap is not yet available but they say they are working on it.  Also, can't find an Ap for Amazon Prime  video although there is one to play Amazon prime video on the iPad.  Hopefully Amazon will get one available soon for the Android.  - Music Transferability - this is both a negative and a positive.  If you have all your music in Apple iTunes it will take a little work to transfer into the Android system.  That said, Apple iTunes I find to be too restrictive and I'm trying to move away from them.  There are aps and utilities out there that can do this for you.  - Picture Transferability - Apple does a very nice job with it's iPhoto program and then transfers all of your albums seamlessly to your iPad and/or iPhone.  That said, it appears that Google's Picasa can now import your iPhoto albums.  I will be trying to make that transition but I do have to complement Apple on the ease of use of their iPhoto program between their devices.After one week I am thrilled with the Samsung Galaxy Note and highly recommend it.  I find it worth the transition away from Apple and with just a little bit of work will be more powerful and convenient than the iPad was.

Reviews.Title: Great for students in college
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I am currently in college right now and this tablet has become essential for my day to day life at school. It is great for taking notes reading books in pdf form (an app is required for this though). The tablet also works great for checking email making last minute changes to a paper with Polaris or office suite along with skydrive.

Reviews.Title: Great tab.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I know there are over 600 reviews for the Note 10.1 2014 but I wanted to put my 2 cents in. I have the original Galaxy Tab 10.1 GT-P7510 that I got two years ago and liked it but it was buggy and slooow and would have to re-boot a lot. I decided I wanted to upgrade and get something I could multi-task with and have good battery life.I read and watched reviews and settled on the Note 2014 32G. I got it the 1st week of January and have used it every day I've had it. I have read some people had lag problems or battery drain problems but I have not any problems with anything. I did install Nova Launcher Prime (I had it on my Tab) and use Chrome browser. My Note is fast and smooth. Very snappy when I swipe and change apps. I'm not a game player so I can't address that but I have watched movies on it and the screen is awesome and movie play is flawless.Typical for me is: I can read a magazine, a few chapters of a book, watch a few YouTubes, play around with the S-Pen while listening to some music, surf the web, surf Amazon and place an order, check email and Facebook and do a couple of lessons of an on-line course and general messing around and still have 1/3 of the battery left at the end of the day. I can easily go a couple of days with a battery charge. I was lucky to get a day on my Tab 10.1 with less use. I usually plug it in at night while I sleep but there have been times that I want to top the battery off and it seems to charge fairly quick.I use this tablet every day and really enjoy using it. I bought the Samsung smart case and also use FlexArmorX pouch because I take it with me when I go to work and when I travel.I do wish Samsung made it easier to sync stuff from one device to another. I'm still trying to get files from my Tab to my Note but that's a Samsung issue, not a Note 2014 issue. I would recommend the Note 10.1 2014 to anyone wanting a fast, powerful and pleasure to use tablet. There is a learning curve but that's part of the experience. I did buy and download "Samsung Galaxy Tabs for Dummies" by Dan Gookin. Copyright 2014. It covers all Galaxy Tabs and the Note. It's $10 from Amazon and I have learned some good and helpful stuff. I would recommend it whether you're new to tabs or, like me, have had an older tab.

Reviews.Title: SO much more than the iPad
Reviews.Author: V. Quinlan
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that we are huge Apple fans from way back.  I gave my husband an iPad for Christmas, and he's very happy with it.  I was looking specifically for a tablet with a port for an SD card so that I could take the card from my camera and pop the photo's directly into my tablet.  This is one of the few tablets with an SD port - the iPad does not, so it wasn't even on my short list.I love that the tablet plays nicely with my camera, but it does so many more amazing things that were happy surprises.  I particularly like the S pen functions - scrapbook is a great way to keep track of recipe's I want to put on my menu plan for the week or DIY projects I want to try.  I even used it to take pictures of haircuts that I liked to show to my hairdresser - very handy feature.  S note is great for grocery lists, reminders, and idea's that I would otherwise loose track of.As far as speed goes, I'm absolutely pleased with the speed of all of the tasks I use it for.  Quick surfing, video's play well, and the screen is rich and amazing.  The sound isn't great, though, but we paired it with a little Jam bluetooth speaker or the Bose speakers in our RV and it works great.There are lots of tips and tricks available on Samsung.com to help you get the most out of this tablet.  I've found them very helpful.  I'm really happy with my tablet choice - it does everything I would want it to, is light and easily portable, the battery life is more than enough, and it's very user friendly.  Combined with the ability to expand with the SD card, it's an easy top pick.

Reviews.Title: A tablet made for students and musicians as well as for media lovers
Reviews.Author: Jakob S.
Reviews.Content: I must first start out by saying that I had the note 10.1 2012 version before purchasing this one and I have been pleased with all of the Samsung products that I have.The display is amazing compared to the old note 10.1. I am out and about all day every day for work and school and always have my tablet with me for quick notes, or if I have some extra time, for watching movies. The display was the main reason I got this tablet.I compared and contrasted this display with my iPad 3rd generation which has the retina display, as well as compared it to the old note 10.1. One of the problems that I had with the Note 10.1 2012 was that it always had an awful glare especially when I was outside or in a room with a lot of windows or with lot of light. It killed me because the old note was very powerful but the screen always had a very annoying glare. The screen on the old note 10.1 was also not as sensitive to the touch as my iPad 3 did. The speakers on the old note were not as good as the iPad 3 either. But with the new note 10.1 2014, Samsung really nailed everything right on the head. The screen on the new note 10.1 2014 outperforms the note 10.1 2012 by a long shot. The screen is brighter and way more vivid. It is also a lot more sensitive to the touch. Those annoying glares that I always got with the note 10.1 2012 were gone. I also noticed that the speakers were significantly louder than the ipad 3 and the note 10.1 2012, but the ipad had a lot more bass it it's speakers.One problem that I had with the iPad, as a student, was that it was somewhat difficult to take notes while in class. There really aren't any very good word processors made for the iPad. The note 2014 comes with Polaris Office which is really similar to Microsoft Word. It is a fully functioning word processor. What I like most is that through Polaris Office, you can set it up to save all of your documents straight to google drive so that your documents can be synced to all of your devices. For example: I start an essay in class and save it; when I get home, I can continue working on it on my computer; then when I am on the bus I can read it on my Note 3 cell phone. You can make word, excel, and even powerpoint presentations right there on your tablet. I purchased a keyboard case for it and paired with my Razer Orochi bluetooth mouse, it is nearly a computer!While using a bluetooth mouse and a bluetooth keyboard with the wifi and bluetooth on all the time, this tablet lasts me all day and even into the next day for a little if I forget to charge it. And because it is so small and light, it is very easy to carry around all day rather than having to carry a bulky laptop.Another useful feature is the app Watch-on. Because the note 10.1 2014 has an IR sensor in it, you can pretty much control anything that uses an IR remote. I have it set up with my 42" TV, my bluray player, my cable box, and my receiver. I did find the app somewhat difficult to use sometimes because you can pretty much only use it when your line of sight is directly above the tablet and since you have to line up to IR sensor to your TV when you want to change the channel, sometimes you don't always hit the right buttons.Another thing I use it for a lot is for music. I am involved in the Millennial Choral Organizations in Mesa, AZ which requires that I memorize a lot of music in a relatively short period of time. I just take a picture of the music using one of the Cam Scan apps and save it as a PDF until the end of the semester when I delete it all. Part of having all of this music is having to write notes on how the conductor wants it to sound. One thing I was a little disappointed in was that it does not have the capability of writing notes on the PDF and then saving them. But what I figured out is that you can select free write after you pull out the s-pen and then I can write my notes on it and it saves it as a screenshot. I wish that it had the capabilities to do write on the PDF, but unfortunately, you cant.Overall it is a great and powerful tablet.

Reviews.Title: A great product that finally stablized in it's update releases.
Reviews.Author: Jeffry J. Brickley
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews of this product (or at least a large portion) to fully understand why the mixed rating and did I want to take the risk or not. $600 was a huge investment for me on the risk of new technology. HOWEVER, I bought this after all the updates were out, and things were already looking better. You can see the line in the reviews for when this happened. This is customary for new technology. I have had a rooted kindle and have had helped others with an iPad, but I really wanted something that was Android and good enough to use many of the features of my phone on a pad (I have a Samsung S4, near enough to the technology in this product to sway the purchase).Snote is working much better since the update. Most of the other technology is working really good. I have not removed the Knox interface as many have threatened (and some have done). The primary reason is update path. I am still waiting for a good bluetooth keyboard case for this and I want the update path so far. That does not mean I may stick with it forever, but I actually use the Knox interface to split my business/home use. This is very handy. I have packed this pad with goodies and it's still going strong. I use both the Spen and a standard pad stylus from my roocase purchased at the same time. The Spen actually has the detail/resolution to grab the timesheet program interface bar that is buggy on a mobile interface (it gets squashed).The camera has less resolution than my S4, but actually has slightly better light and color response. I have not used the front facing camera and am unlikely to in the near future. I am just not a visual chat person.All in all this pad is stable in the current update mark and operates fast and efficiently for everything that I do. As a returning student I look forward to how this pad can help in both work and school organization.

Reviews.Title: An artist's dream of a tablet.
Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: After years of research, I can say this is one of the better deals, if not the best, for someone who wants to draw or paint on a tablet. The version of Sketchbook made for the tablet, which comes for free, is feature rich (layers, layer controls, pressure sensitive brushes, rulers, symmetries etc.) and pretty easy to figure out, even coming from Photoshop. You will have to learn a new style of doing things, as your capabilities will be stripped down a lot, but the simplicity can be a muse of sorts.The $25 credit you get when you register the device can help get you a few more choice programs for your artistic needs. I recommend Sketchbook Ink as well. I had a lot of trouble finding reviews with artists' opinions, so I figured I'd throw one on here to help any other amateurs like me!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 2014
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Carter
Reviews.Content: This was purchased to replace a two year old tablet that was getting too slow.  It is a great tablet with plenty of storage space and seem to be very fast.  It fits my needs exactly.

Reviews.Title: new 2014
Reviews.Author: Eric Mattfeld
Reviews.Content: its fast and wrks well I would recommend it to anyone. I have found no issues with it and it lasts long and charges quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great Toys
Reviews.Author: Jason Thurlow
Reviews.Content: After reviewing three other tablets (non-Apple) I chose this one.  With the enhancements from the previous version, the 2014 version has been perfect for me.  I am not a gamer nor use it work work purposes, it is more of a all purpose tablet than anything else.  It is very easy to use, especially since it operates very similar to my Galaxy III Smartphone. The view playback is great, the sounds is very good for a tablet, the battery life is decent and the camera is not bad. The only dislike would be that it is a little pricey, but the overall functionality outweighs the cost. I would definitely recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great battery life - still learning all the features
Reviews.Author: Dog Lover
Reviews.Content: Great tablet.  I still haven't learned all the features yet (guess I have to break down and read the manual), but the tablet works great, battery lasts for days.  I also love the textured backing on this since it doesn't slip.

Reviews.Title: Open your mind to life after iTunes ...
Reviews.Author: Rusty_In_OR
Reviews.Content: This gadget is amazing.  I love my Samsung Galaxy SIII phone, and I needed a tablet that was better than the older one I have now (early generation iPad).  This Galaxy 10.1 (2014) is everything I'd hoped for, and more.  Light, well-made, easy to use, versatile, great screen, long battery life, zillions of apps, more memory, easy use of cheap expansion memory cards, and multiple ways to do virtually everything.  The integrated S-Pen is really a great feature missing in other tablets.  I'm still looking for the "con's" to offset the "pro's", but I think the only down-side is that anyone that has consumed the Apple Kool-Aide simply won't like it because it's not an iPad.  Anybody that approaches this product with any kind of an open mind, will see how much better it is to be "Free", than to be chained to "iTunes".  Finally, a tablet that truly competes with the iPad in every way, and actually WINS in many of them.

Reviews.Title: Love it +++++
Reviews.Author: P. Chebib
Reviews.Content: I love the new Samsung Note 2014 edition. I sold all my I pads and I can't put it out of my hands. I love the fast responsive screen and the pen,.I use it at work and were able to put it tons of app for my work. Excellent WiFi and battery life. I will never go back to the" I" thing, ever again.It is worth the money and then some.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied with this product and Amazon as a business.
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my daughter, and was honestly kind of worried about it surviving, as she is not the appropriate age that most would see fit to use such a device. She will be 2 in January. Since we purchased it she has been kinda ruff with it, and it doesn't look any worse for wear. Granted we take plenty of precautions, but it is not nearly as fragile as a lot of products these days.The whole family uses it but I got it mainly for educational purposes for my daughter, and just the short while she has played with it I am already happy with my purchase. The S pen has fantastic response to her movement when playing games or painting. It is truly amazing to me how much she is able to do on this device at such a young age. The response of the screen with her fingers or pen are spot on and lets her do exactly what it is she wants to do. If she is painting the screen will register all of her fingers when she paints and she loves it. I have had trouble finding time to learn the device because she is always on it.This is the first tablet I have purchased. I have a desktop and a laptop that has taken care of all my needs before, but man have I been missing out. Its like I stepped out of a time machine with this thing. I have spent several hours just playing with all the features, like i'm a kid again( When i can get it away from my daughter). My wife and I are both in school, and this tablet is going to be much more useful there than our laptops were also. Words are crisp and light can be adjusted well so that its a pleasant experience reading. This will save us more than the price of the tablet in the end on the savings for ebooks and textbooks. I foresee myself buying another tablet for my family in the near future, because one just isn't going to be enough for all 3 of us.Also, I have to mention that Amazons customer support has been amazing for all my holiday shopping this year. I dealt with a competitors market on a product I purchased recently and it was so awful. My experience with Amazon has been so good in comparison to others that I will no longer be bargain shopping through competitors. All my online dealing will be through Amazon so long as they stay competitive and value there customers.

Reviews.Title: Worth the wait !
Reviews.Author: Moya
Reviews.Content: Brilliant piece of technology.Graphics are outstanding, very fast performance, multi window / note / drawing and scrapbook are great tools.Suits family and work better than any piece of technology I have owned.

Reviews.Title: This is the best tablet out there.
Reviews.Author: RJOHNSON
Reviews.Content: This is amazing tablet. The note and writing feature is indeed a draw card for taking quick notes. The voice commands for the Galaxy is very helpful. You can schedule alarms or events just by speaking to the tablet. The resolution is the best that's out there. This is the best tablet out there.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely amazing... Where every tablet should be
Reviews.Author: A. Rodriguez "Other Me"
Reviews.Content: It's beautiful, speedy, functional, light. I love the design. My only complaint is more accessories and more internal memory. I know it would drive the price higher, but I would like to have the option.. Absolutely love this device.Pen writing is intuitive, easy, I don't use the keyboard anymore, interpretation is accurate. Speach recognition is absolutely amazing. Applications like action memo and Snote are invaluable.  This device will be at the top of its class for some time!

Reviews.Title: Great Business Tablet!
Reviews.Author: A.L.  Rusca
Reviews.Content: Awesome tablet!  I'm still learning all it can do.  I use technology as a tool for my business, I'm not a true techie.  First thing I did was purchase a book style cover and screen protector.  Second was to install a 16 Gig memory card. So far no issues.  The tablet is fast when surfing the Internet, the screen is clear and bright with fantastic colors.  I read the reviews before my purchase and I have not experienced any of the performance delays some of the reviewers write about. This tablet is head and shoulders better than my 3 year old Galaxy 7" tablet.The TV IR controller is a fun bonus especially since I have a Samsung Smart TV.  They mated quickly and perfectly.I've begun to add files for a MS Power Point presentation, a small learning curve but I've got it now and they look great!  The installed Office Aps work perfectly.  My MS Word files transferred and open flawlessly.  Excel works just as nicely.Found out that our local Best Buy has a Samsung Tech Counter with free tech support to help unravel the secrets of using these high tech Samsung products. Has Samsung taken a hint from Apple?  I haven't used them yet but plan to have all my questions answered as I use more of it's capabilities.All in all, this Tablet has done everything I've asked of it and is capable of much more as I become more proficient.  I love it and am totally happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Android 4.4 criticaly limits MicroSD use; Sluggish performance; Offers limited
Reviews.Author: Hodor
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (black, 16GB) at Best Buy a few weeks ago. I only used it for a few days before deciding to return it. There's a lot of stupid problems here, not all of which are Samsung's fault. But overall, it's a no-deal for me.1) The Simpsons game "Tapped Out" ran so slow as to be unusable. The constant stuttering of the screen updates and the slowed-down animation made it obvious that somehow this particular game challenged the quad-core processor in the Note. It's a serious defect, considering a two year old model like the ASUS TF300 could run the game 10 times faster, and THAT unit is sluggish. This might be a specific issue with this game, and could be a software fix from EA. But it's important to consider, as the game it's very popular and widely used.2) The offers are  good deals, but they are limited to the device itself. For example, the free year of GoGo Inflight Internet? That's not something you can add to your existing account or even create a new account for. Instead, everytime you want to use it you must connect to GoGo from this tablet, click on a "Chat Now" button and request from a CSR a one-time code for that flight. You'll need to repeat that process everytime you want to use it, and it can't be used on a laptop or other device. Similar limitations exist for many, but not all of the offers. The 3 free audio books? Only 1 per month. All of these offers are really just trial subscriptions with a few exceptions. I *strongly* recommend checking out the details and fine-print here before buying: [...]3) This Note uses Android 4.4 aka "KitKat". There is a major change in Android 4.4 that affects how MicroSD card access works. Apps will no longer be able to access the entire card and read or write anywhere they want. Instead, each app will have its own little closed-off area to use, nothing else. This means general-purpose file explorer apps will not be able to see anything on a MicroSD card. Photo viewers will be similarly limited. Backup programs will not be able to backup files from a MicroSD card (though they will be able to backup file TO the MicroSD card). Most significantly, you will NOT be able to move apps to the MiroSD to free-up space in the internal memory. This is all being done by Google, not Samsung, but it still impacts this model. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND YOU READ THESE ARTICLES BEFORE PURCHASING THIS DEVICE:[...][...]

Reviews.Title: GREAT SAMSUNG TABLET WITH AMAZING CUTTING EDGE TECH-BUY FROM AMAZON FOR PRICE AND SERVICE!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased the new Samsung from Amazon.  It stopped working right 3 days after receipt.  I purchased the 3 year warranty, but my experience with these warranties was negative because Best Buy refused to even look at my last tablet the ASUS Transformer 700 when I took it to the store under the same type of warranty.  Best Buy Geek Squad Manager said it was an unidentified software problem,  thus not covered under the warranty.  They even wanted over $60 to set the tablet back to factory original. This requires 2 keystrokes.  One year later and at least 6 hard resets later they finally replaced the ASUS under warranty.  Skip ahead to March 2014. We bought the new Samsung and it stopped working after 3 days.  We spent 2 hours on the phone with Samsung.  Technical support top level tech stated it was a hardware error.  Finally after 2 hours and at some level of management,  we were told by Samsung that we could send the 3 day old device in for repairs,  it would take a month and we would end up with a device that wasn't new and had been cracked open. This was unacceptable. The manager finally transferred us to a very nice woman at Amazon.  It took less than 10 minutes and she had sent a new Samsung device along with return instructions sent to my email. I had the new device in hand on Monday and it's working and the broken one was picked up all by a very pleasant woman from Amazon.  By the way,  I'm very tech savvy and have a Sony Vaio, a new Droid Maxx, and a new iPhone 5.  This Samsung 10.1 2014 with 64gb is amazing.  It is the most intuitive and loaded tablet I've ever seen.  GREAT DEVICE. AND EVEN BETTER PURCHASE BY ORDERING THROUGH AMAZON.  Samsung may not stand behind their product, but AMAZON sure does. If you're ready to move into the next generation of tablets, buy this Samsung and just in case you get a lemon, buy it from AMAZON for service after the sale and it's also the cheapest place to purchase!

Reviews.Title: Exellent .....product and service from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Rory Ellickson
Reviews.Content: Being older, 63...new stuff is always a challenge....but the Galaxy 10.1 note is great...I have two laptops, and I do a bit of traveling and have found the laptops a bit cumbersome. This unit is perfect for catching up on the news, reservations, emails and the such..took a bit of time to get the swing of "verbal" emails, but watching the words pop up on the screen as I talked...was fun...So you can teach an 'ol dog new tricks...carry on.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet Period
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "presidentsdad"
Reviews.Content: Let me say that I'm coming from an Asus Transformer Pad Infinity (TF-700t).  That tablet was quite possibly the largest POS on the planet.  Now...having said that...The Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition is INCREDIBLE.  I LOVE this tablet.  It is LAG FREE, has i incredible screen, the s pen features are VERY cool.  In all this is a lightweight, compact, full size, full power Android tablet that kicks the iPad Air's behind.  Only negatives I have for it is that is doesn't come with Swype and it does take a bit of time to fully charge.  Other than that there is nothing this tablet cannot do!!  It is AMAZING!!!  App to app is very fast, multi window is very cool and useful.  The S pen Screen Write is a very cool feature.  The Action Note is great and the hand writing recognition is nothing short of amazing.  My handwriting is awful and it picks up a vast majority of the writing.  I LOVE my new tablet and you will too.  It is definitely worth the price.  It delivers on all it promises and Samsung has produced a fabulous tablet.  Also, I have  the MK1 firmware (from the factory) and have NO lag and also have multi user support.  Buy this....you will NOT be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: a great tablet for the creative professional on a budget
Reviews.Author: Seamstress Fitzhugh
Reviews.Content: This tablet is absolutely amazing. It  caught my interest because of the capabilities of the spen. I had read online that the previous incarnation of the Note had clunky software, and didn't always work as advertised. The 2014 model, however, seems to have solved any issues that the older model may have had.As an artist the real-time stylus capabilities really caught my eye. I was also impressed that the stylus was built by the wacom company - I may be wrong, but I think this is the only tablet outside of the wacom family of products to use this technology. I have been wanting a tablet wih the capability to draw in real-time, and this tablet does not disappoint. It may not have the capabilities of a high-end Wacom drawing tablet, but for the price point it is great for sketching on the go. The stylus, while fairly basic, has the precision and usefulness you expect out of a wacom product.The multitasking feature is very nice as well. I use my tablet for work and find it really handy to be able to work between multiple apps, pull out the spen for a quick sketch of an idea, and then jot down a phone number - all with ease.If you just want a tablet as a "media consumption device", then I would suggest you take a look at a more value- priced tablet. However, if you are a creative professional and need something you can easily take with you to act as sketchbook, datebook, notepad, etc. and either can't afford or don't want to carry around a pricey wacom tablet, this may just be the gadget for you!

Reviews.Title: Best tablet I've ever owned and the most functional too.
Reviews.Author: B100
Reviews.Content: Pros:1. Screen is very, very good, the best screen I've seen on any tablet, period!2. Love the inclusion of micro SD card support so I can expand my memory3. Generally significantly faster than the older Note 10.14. Speakers are nice and loud5. The camera is okay, but doesn't appear to be nearly as good as that of the first galaxy tab 10.1 or 8.06. Love the multitasking features but this needs to be expanded to support every app, not just a select few7. The S Pen is awesome. This single innovation makes it the most functional tablet for me8. S Note is also a great app9. Build quality is very good. The tablet feels solid and premium. I love the faux leather back10. The battery is significantly better than that of the older Note 10.1. It should easily last an entire day with moderate to heavy use11. Multitasking is awesome. You can open multiple apps at the same time. This make is so much more functionalCons:1. S Note too slow for my liking and even slower than in old Note 10.12. S Note and S memo need to be merged like they were on the old Note 10.13. Software needs to be optimized to run faster and more smoothly. Yes, there's lag on this device. The intermittent lag doesn't render it unusable to any extent but it's annoying to say the least. Hopefully a software update eliminates this.4. Battery life could use some improvement (better than the old Note 10.1 though)5. The menu, back and home buttons arrangement is terrible and gets in the way all the time. They should revert to virtual buttons like on the older Galaxy Note 10.1. The virtual buttons worked perfectly well, why screw up something that's not broken.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Device
Reviews.Author: Dylan
Reviews.Content: This device is just amazing. It is incredibly fast with its 2 quad core processors. Works amazing, and the S-pen is a really great feature. The battery life is really good also.

Reviews.Title: Samsung's quality control is absolutely terrible
Reviews.Author: Blueadder
Reviews.Content: Note showed up with dead pixels. No big deal, it happens. Dealt with if for about a week but then decided to send it off to Samsung because they said it will be fixed and back in my hands in 7 days. Just get it back today 3 weeks later(21 days) to find that the silver band that runs along the edge wasn't properly reinstalled and is sitting up just high enough that it hides the volume and power buttons. Really? Tried to see if it just needed to be popped in place or if I could get it to sit flush with the body, but no luck. You had 3 weeks to get it right and that's what you send back?Call up Samsung and get the ole, "Well it's only been sent off once, so we can't just replace it. Send it back and we'll fix it right up for you. If it's messed up when you get it back next time call us and we will try and make it right." Wow. Ok. At least this costumer rep was smart enough not to promise me a time frame when I asked them if they planned on keeping it for another 3 weeks.I would have just sent it back to Amazon for an exchange, but they didn't have any more at the time and now it's too late. When I get it back and am actually able to use it, I'll give a real review. Until then, hopefully not 3 weeks, I'll just let this review sit here and stew.

Reviews.Title: finally, a powerful tablet capable of producing!
Reviews.Author: AnnMarie Adams
Reviews.Content: I've held off on buying a tablet for a couple years for one main reason - lack of ability to produce. While this is my first tablet i'm not sure tablets get any better than this, right now. I am completely satisfied with its capabilities.  I wanted something smaller and lighter than a netbook. but it had to be able to produce for work. seems like the majority of tablets on the market are marketed toward the entertainment end - videos, games, net surfing. i needed something i can produce and modify products on. this is it. This machine can handle .docx/.pptx/.xlsx files with ease and even creates them.A couple comments - if bloatware drives you insane, you might want to research which products are out there that don't stack their offerings with bloatware. this thing came with lots of stuff i can't get rid of. with only 16gb of on board memory, 6gb is taken up by the operating system and some of this bloaware. only 10gb are left for internal storage. not all apps can be placed on the SD card. if i had the 32gb i'd still make that complaint. i resolved this with the next comment.This edition (2014) of the Note accepts 64gb SD cards. There is some question out there as to whether or not it does. Mine accepts with no issue a 64gb PNY SDXC micro. No reformatting, no special app, no nothing. not sure if they accept higher than 64gb. if they do, that's even better capability. i'm not a big fan of loading up on apps that get used once a month so keeping 10gb of space available inside with the remainder on the card is more than plenty for the average user. if this isnt enough you might want to rethink what you are storing. do you really listen to 25gb of music. probably not. there are also other wireless storage options out there now that might make for a nice pairing with a tablet if you really need more storage.If you are on the fence about "useful" tablets like i have been, this is the tablet to take you off the fence. Pair this tablet with a wifi keyboard/case and you're golden. there are a number of keyboard\case combos out there for about $35 that are pretty sweet and they work well. I really can't see myself ever traveling again with a laptop.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this product!!  It meets all my expectations and I would recommend it for others! Also arrived quickly.

Reviews.Title: The best out there !!
Reviews.Author: Juan Rojas
Reviews.Content: Simply the best you can get..The freedom of customizing the unit as you want is something that makes you love it..Support for the majority of your portable needs..

Reviews.Title: gh
Reviews.Author: gina lynn hayslip
Reviews.Content: very pleased with purchase very compatible with my galaxy phone  i didn't even know all the things that could be done by combing the two

Reviews.Title: trying to master it's capabilities is a challenge for us ederly less tech savvy.
Reviews.Author: Stephen C. Sisk
Reviews.Content: I am used to having a print instruction manual and was not about to print out the on-line manual. I am slowly learning the system and adding apps as needed.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for Student
Reviews.Author: DowntownSF
Reviews.Content: This tablet is perfect for taking notes in class. At first I wasn't sure that a tablet could be used for effectively taking notes during class but now I'm sold on the concept.Pros:Ability to send/save notes to yourself/others in multiple formats.Picks up writing smoothly and accurately.Nice formula match ability, useful for math notes.Multiple pen, marker, highlighting types and sizes to get your notes looking just right.Can write directly on screen shots of anything with the air-command menu(useful for pdf books).Cons:Can only take notes in landscape at the moment(not really a problem but might bother some people).Gets a little hot after a few hours of note taking.If multiple programs are in memory the writing can become laggy.Tips for note taking:Lock your notebooks!(Accidentally deleted one, the lock will force you to enter a code to confirm deletion).Adjust the pen width to the smallest size and zoom in on the notebook page(looks a lot better when you convert to pdf).Take notes and use the internet or look at a pdf at the same time by using the samsung sidebar.Hit the Save button before you exit! Auto-save is not constant.

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet if you need a pen
Reviews.Author: C. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I have read hours of reviews. I found good & bad to each review. Having the Note 2, I wanted to give this tablet a try. To me it operates like my Note 2. I really enjoy my note 2 and the tablet is no different. If you have a Note device and don't Use the Pen, Save yourself some money and get a Tab Tablet. I Use the pen about 80% of the time, so itis natural for me.Over all the operating system is smooth. I find little to no lag when swyping or accessing apps. The tablet has a lot features such as an IR. Most won't use it, but I find it handy to control my tv. Here are a few things that I like the most.1. The Screen resolution is amazing2. Browser works flawlessly. I travel a lot and I have had no wifi issues anywhere I have used the tablet.3. Tablet is smooth and fast4. Pen is very Comfortable and writes smooth with a Zagg HD Screen Protector5. I never run out of RAM and I have not had any issues with the tablet running slow.6. No issues with Bluetooth or WIFI7. With the Micro SD slot, I have lots of Storage.Things I dislike1. Built in video Player skips when watching movies2. Samsung did not include the shortcut features that the Note 2 has3. The auto brightness works great if outside, but when there little to no light the Screen is to dim. I find myself making manual adjustments4. Battery life is not as good as Some tablets this Size. Though with the note 2, using the Pen drains the battery more with use. This could be the same with the tablet.Overall,Ian happy with the tablet. $600 is a bit Steep, but the pen features are what I like the most. So far I have hot had any issues,

Reviews.Title: Amazing Tablet
Reviews.Author: ajn1963
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my aged Toshiba Thrive Tablet.  This table it incredible.Sound is beautiful.  Video is sharp.  The S-PEN and writing and speaking features are incredible.  That Toshiba Thrive was like a stone tablet compared to this device.  I actually do not type out text messages or email anymore, I write them with the S-PEN, and even speaking, the speech to text works amazingly well.  Just used to hand interaction to send messages.I can't find anything bad to say about this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Diane T.
Reviews.Content: This was my first tablet and I love it, of course I don't have anything to compare it with.  The display is gorgeous, like using the S-pen and like having the option of adding more memory.  The apps offered are all I need and they have a lot of apps in the App store.  Would definitely buy again.

Reviews.Title: My first Tablet and am Very Happy.
Reviews.Author: fedexbicman
Reviews.Content: I considered a lot of variables before buying the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (32GB, Black)After weighing out cost, processing speed, operating system, storage space and expandability I chose this product.It's screen size makes it easy to see and read.  The clarity of the screen is superb and the Hi Definition images are crisp and sharp.  I was hoping I could use one of my favorite programs on the tablet but, unfortunately there isn't an app for it yet.  However, there is a suitable substitute app that I am using and learning to like.  It is Sketchbook Pro.  Learning it is not hard and getting used to the brushes has been fairly easy.  I am used to Corel, Painter Lite.  I love the mixing and blending abilities that this program has and I will always be watching for the release of an Android based App for it.I would recommend this Tablet to anyone considering and Android based product.

Reviews.Title: I Love The Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014!
Reviews.Author: Patti A. Godwin "cricket"
Reviews.Content: I Love The Samsung Galaxy Note!I Love All The Features!It Takes The Best Pictures!I Love To Take It With Me Wherever I Go! I Love How Easy It Is To Operate!

Reviews.Title: Works better for me than the Ipad.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Carter
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet.  I own both this and Ipad air. The Samsung meets my needs with the S-pen.  I use it a lot.  The speed is great. Sure there are a couple of specialty apps on the Ipad I can't get on android, but majority of them, I can. Also, I use the Samsung galaxy s4 phone, so they match up better.  And it seems to work with  chromecast better than Ipad. The Ipad keeps dropping connection to it, but not the samsung.  If you are really in to making hand written notes or drawing, then the note is for you.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: salogub, roxanne
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a Christmas and the giftee is loving it.  User friendly, easy.  Learn something new everyday.  Great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Much better buy than Ipad
Reviews.Author: Jason Tu "Dog Photo Man"
Reviews.Content: I own  Ipad, Asus Transformer and Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 edition (bought not from Amazon). It is fast and has a beautiful display and the battery lasts > 10 hours. I bought Note 10.1 for reasons: 1) price 2) Android software selection 3) more files/format support.  4) the sound quality. I really can not fault anything on this tablet. The boot time is fast, 64db sd card and great camera/pictures. I just wish that it can be larger up to the laptop size say greater than 15 inch. Yes, make it lighter and thinner so I can carry it anywhere. If I have only one tablet to buy, I will go for Note for the return of my money. Ipad is too expensive and Apple has too many restrictions on everything. The built quality is also great. The offer Samsung is giving is also attractive.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet-Worth The Price
Reviews.Author: Disabled Veteran
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet 3 weeks, and am very satisfied with my purchase, not to mention receiving it tax free!  Now, my wife also wants one, which I will purchase for her. The tablet exceeded my expectations in every relm!  I spent a month researching two other tablets, by Toshiba and Apple, the Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 won hands down!  Even at the current price, I would highly recommend this tablet for serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.  Only complaint was the lack of a manual but I was able to find it online finally.  Learn new things every day.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Machine
Reviews.Author: A. Wal "TW"
Reviews.Content: Received mine yesterday morning and started playing with it when I got home from work.  What started off as a quick poking around to get the know the machine turned into me sitting in my recliner until 2am enjoying my new toy.  The Android interface is smooth as silk as always and Samsung has no shortage of features packed into the hardware itself.  I have an iPad through my company, and all I can say is that Apple better do something quickly to catch up, because Samsung is miles ahead of them right now.

Reviews.Title: Easly one of the best gadgets I now own
Reviews.Author: Adam Thomas
Reviews.Content: The 10.1 note is just amazing. I am currently a student and i wanted to purchase a tablet because i was tiered of carring around my books for my various classes. I was looking around and I saw this one. The thing that sold me on this was the fact that I can use it just like a note book and take physical notes on the tablet its self, its a really cool feature. I was skeptical on how the writing would look, but it looks like writing you would write on a piece of paper, its that accurate on the detail of it. Now I happly use it in class to take notes and pull up my pdf files of books the professor asks us to look at.Its a great buy for students such as myself. Its lightning fast if you need to use the interent, the camera takes amazingly high detailed pictures, the note taking feature is so useful, and its really compact. You cant go wrong with it!

Reviews.Title: 4 stars as everything in life always has room for improvement.
Reviews.Author: Pauline Joshua
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this product. It is customizable, sleek/stylish, easy to use, and does everything i wanted it to do. I also like the fact that word doc, xl files, ppt, etc can be viewed and edited on this tablet. Recently I purchased a car and it was awesome to have the xl file of all the offers with me as i went from dealership to dealership. The only thing i didn't like abt this is the fact that it can be quite difficult to edit these files. But it does do it but just a bit slower than a computer.One thing I don't like about the tablet is the fact that the charging port is at the bottom and it is nearly impossible to charge and use it at the same time. The way I bypassed this problem is by taking my tablet out of the case and putting it back in upside down so the charge port is on the top. With screen rotation on, the tablet automatically adjusts. But this is is SUCH a hassle to do it every time I want to charge and use at the same time, which is pretty frequent. Like I said... there is always room for improvement.I will update this review as I use it more.As far as recommendations... I would 100% recommend this product to others. In fact I am already doing so, and no, I do not work of Samsung or get paid for this.

Reviews.Title: For the wife
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I really have never used this yet since I can't get the wife and son off of it. So that must mean it great and work fine with plenty of speed. Happy wife happy life!

Reviews.Title: A great improvement over Note 10.1 2012 Edition
Reviews.Author: Discerning Buyer
Reviews.Content: I love my old Note 10.1. In fact, if I had not been passing it along to my other half when they decided they wanted one, I would have kept that for a good long time. The new 2014 edition is great especially in the screen. It is beautiful. It is as beautiful as the Note 3 screen which I have as well. It is faster than the old Note 10.1. How much so from a noticeability perspective? For my stuff... not dramatically noticeable (to me). If your use cases are different than mine then you will probably notice a huge difference but most of my work on it is not too demanding. It is more about comfort and relaxation for me than a workhorse. Any time I have needed it to come to bat with power, it was not sluggish or cumbersome in any way and I feel like it would meet most if not all workhorse demands that could be thrown at it. There are a lot of improvements beyond the screen. Many aesthetic. The lack of onscreen menu and back buttons is a little tricky to get used to after having them before. It is a trade off, screen real estate used for content vs navigation being right in front of you at all times. A lot of new integrations and application improvements come with it as well. The build is of great quality and It feels very solid. I had a case for my old Note 10.1 and I would say it is required for the 2014 version. I could not imagine using this in any serious manner without a case. It is just too slippery to prop up somewhere, on something etc. To hold it, not very slippy but to lean it against something? Forget it... get a case. I can tell you this as well. All in all however a great purchase and would not hesitate.

Reviews.Title: Powerfull, stable, everything you could need.
Reviews.Author: Marco Illescas
Reviews.Content: Surely there will be something better tomorrow and maybe other OS users have a different opinion, it is an instinctive reaction when leadership is challenged. But I have 20 years of working in IT and I find that this device is able to do whatever you need in real life. The Google play strore have some limitations in terms of professional and entertainment applications, mainly by access restrictions to regional and monopolized markets, but not for long.

Reviews.Title: As awesome as you think it would be, a true power house.
Reviews.Author: nexgen91
Reviews.Content: I am loving the Note 10.1 2014 it beats my old TF700 into the dirt, the multi tasking capabilities of this tablet are amazing. I have ran some very graphics intensive games and it handled them without a hiccup. I am truly impressed with this tablets capabilities. The S Pen and interface is amazing, only thing I wish was there was more pen window apps than there are but I have found a work around to load documents and such in pen window, here are the directions: open a browser window and search for pdf/docx etc file type that you want to open, find a file on google search results and click it, you will be presented with the open with dialog, now you can select the app to open and it will open in the pen window, from here you can open any document that you want and it will be in the pen window. If I run into any issues with the tablet I will update my review, but as of now I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Way better than iPad Air
Reviews.Author: neod
Reviews.Content: I was in need for a all-around tablet PC for our living room. We wanted to be able to check some of our emails or webpages from a handy device without necesarly using our laptop. I first purchased the iPad because it is all I ever had when it comes to a tablet. But I read the multi-user feature of the Note 10.1 2014 and I imediately exchange my ipad Air for a Note 10.1 2014 edition. and omg, the devide is the same size/weight as the ipad air, as well crafted. and the Multiuser allows me to provide the device to guest at our home even if I have my personal app (facebook and of course amazon app). My guest can't have access to my apps!Love it !

Reviews.Title: Great tablet fun with S pen!
Reviews.Author: Bruck
Reviews.Content: Awesome screen.  S pen function is very nice!  The office apps are nice but not quite as good as having Microsoft office stuff.  I had trouble opening Excel with their version. you can  download something from the android market for this though.  Nice build feels solid in your hands.Cons - battery life could be better,  still waiting on the free stuff that you get with it 4 weeks in takes forever

Reviews.Title: A fantastic tablet.
Reviews.Author: Nathan Duval
Reviews.Content: This item, works well, very similar to my cellphone, so there is no learning curve. The screen is high definition,  crystal clear. The battery life is good, lasting most of the day even when being used by several applications at once.With the Samsung Notes app, and the more powerful word processing applications, this is very easy to create emails and all types of correspondence.The camera that's included takes fantastic photos.  I am using this Note 10.1 in replacement of my Nook Color.  Now I can have my Nook books, my Kindle books, and my Audible books all in one place.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for what it is
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Over the last few months I have been on the search for a tablet. I had never found them to be worth the money that they cost and the few I have tried just didn't do "it" for me.I originally bought this tablet and actually enjoyed it. I was convinced to return it and try a "Surface Pro 2" Long story short. I hated it, it made doing simple things more complicated that they needed to be. I ultimately returned it and purchased this tablet, again.Pros:It's fast.S Pen is "neat".I can do all the things I do regularly on my phone and more.Multi WindowMulti User accounts (suck it ipad)expandable memoryDecent Battery lifeCons:ExpensiveCharge port is on the "bottom" (wtf design)Overall it's great. Would be 5 Stars if charge port was on side

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Benita
Reviews.Content: .when my husband got my tablet. I just couldn't believe my eyes. There's so much u can do. My son is in the Army. Now I can write to him and see him .  Thank God for tablets like this.

Reviews.Title: Apple Killer..
Reviews.Author: Chaplain M.
Reviews.Content: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition (32GB, White)This is a great tablet it is a apple killer the things you can do plus apple dose not have 3gb of Ram

Reviews.Title: Wow Impressive Tablet.
Reviews.Author: Martin J. Rademakers
Reviews.Content: Have used the Samsung galaxy note 10.1 2014 edition for 3 weeks now. It does everything I want with high performance and mobility for a large device. Fantastic graphics. This first Samsung I purchased. Now replacing the iPads for everyone in the family. Impressive Tablet.

Reviews.Title: great tablet + much better then the iPad air
Reviews.Author: Tamaiev "isreal"
Reviews.Content: great tablet + much better then the iPad airYou can do with this tablet anything you want much better than the iPad air, you can download videos from Amy website on the Samsung tablet like a pc, but on the iPad air you cannot, and also the resolution is much better than the iPad air, and it's feels much faster for me, and a lot of features on it, I am highly recommended to anyone that really want to enjoy his tablet.

Reviews.Title: move over nexus 7 now theres something meatier
Reviews.Author: standroid6971
Reviews.Content: At first I was 100%  sold on the 2013 nexus 7 until I actually got to play with it at best buy . The nexus7 (N7)was a complete let down . The same hd video on the N7 1920X1200 screen was even thrumped by even the galaxy note 8.0 sitting beside it even though the note 8.0 is only 1280X800 . Then I saw the new 2014 note 10.1 and man was I blown away . The screen is just a thing of beauty at 2560X1600 . I watch alot of movie on my note2 during breaks breaks at work and the N10.1 didnt disappoint . Im a total Samsung devotee since getn my note2 a while back . So when I saw the note 10.1 I knew that was the tablet for me . Haven't gotn it yet but will update this when ive had the chance to really see what this beast can do . Until then peace my ninjas

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition
Reviews.Author: RICHARD  TREMBLEY
Reviews.Content: Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 Edition is awesome as expected.  There was a delivery problem with the first one I ordered but Amazon shipped a replacement in time for my wife's birthday.

Reviews.Title: It met my expectations
Reviews.Author: Guillermo
Reviews.Content: Such a greta tablet especially because I wanted to do some handwriting when taking notes rather than stroking keys. I love and now I take it everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Best table I have owned,
Reviews.Author: Gadget Nut "RichR"
Reviews.Content: This is the fastest tablet I have used to date. With a 5gb WiFi connection it is super fast. The screen resolution is excellent and the multi-window feature really comes in handy.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Deos
Reviews.Content: It does absolutely everything I want it to. With a large SD card, it is a great replacement for my laptop. If you want a high end tablet, this is a great deal. The TV remote is awesome, the internal power is enough to whatever you throw at it. The battery life is surprisingly long for a screen of this quality.

Reviews.Title: Great price
Reviews.Author: Nicklas Williams
Reviews.Content: The tablet arrived properly packaged with all the accessories.  This is a great price for a new product (discounted for refurbished)

Reviews.Title: Not reviewing the tablet I bought!  It was broken! But I got a new one.
Reviews.Author: Hope Hankin
Reviews.Content: I ordered this and had Bluetooth problems right away...Samsung tech support was NOT helpful (hence my 4 star instead of 5 star review) and indicated that my Bluetooth keyboard was not a Samsung and so may be the problem.  One tech guy however had mentioned it was PERHAPS a firmware problem, so after getting frustrated with Samsung I went to Best Buy with my tablet and the Bluetooth keyboard, and their floor item and all other Samsung devices worked wonderfully with my keyboard.  I bought a replacement from them and I am returning this particular tablet to Amazon.  It is NOT Amazon's fault that they item was defective and I have a few more days to get this returned, which is a policy I love (it took me almost the full 30 days to sort all this out).  As for the Tablet itself, although I detest working with Samsung as a customer service company, their products please me and I will continue to use them as long as they stay at the top of the consumer reports ratings.

Reviews.Title: Wifi is not that great
Reviews.Author: Whitney Clark
Reviews.Content: The wifi is not all that great and is a little slow to respond.  Makes drawing a little difficult.However, it is sleek and light weight:)

Reviews.Title: Wish it had less bloat
Reviews.Author: Hawkins "Biggs"
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Samsung products and especially the S Pen! I own the Note 2 and using both are a joy. My only wish is that I could get a little better performance and less bloat without resorting to rooting it.

Reviews.Title: Wow and wow
Reviews.Author: A. wilson "immortalhighlander"
Reviews.Content: I didn't have enough money to purchase a new laptop computer.  So I researched tablets.  It was either this or the Apple Ipad Air.  It all came down to memory.  Can I upgrade?
